text:
Hello, I usually wouldnt post this here, but tomorrow we are going live with the website tomorrow and the website is loading REALLY slowly.

Could someone confirm that this is a staging issue and it gets fast once pushed online (if best practices were followed)
hi, i have a problem with Form Submissions during the API ...i just see the loading animation after form submit
Does anyone know if the old URL mappings tool is still available, or if I only have access to URL redirects?

in my experience HubSpot sites typically load pretty fast. Google Page Speed nitpicks on a bunch of things we as devs have no control over unfortunately, weighting those things harsher than the reality of their effects. If you you’re using an external service and not locally testing, I would use pingdom, it’s a more accurate gauge of your site’s performance

Hey guys,
Page Translation isn’t available for Staging Content?
I believe that is correct.  I’ve seen a ton of people request the feature on slack so i’d assume it doesn’t yet exist. I’d check the idea forum, odds are someone’s posted requesting it
Ok, thanks
Hey <@UBT0AHWLD> I’m a bit confused as to what might be going on here as the Forms API doesn’t have a UI associated with it. Is there anything you can link to so we can help you out?

Hi <@UHNG8CJ82> :smiley::wave: - We didn't create the bug channel, yet. For now, I'd post in <#C960Q64G4|design-manager> with detailed view of the bug/screen shots/video. Thanks for posting :raised_hands:
may also be helpful <@UBAN5HW3A> <https://www.leadstreet.be/en/blog/HubSpot-ultimate-page-speed-guide>
maybe post a video screencast <@UBT0AHWLD>, please?

Some folks at HubSpot are taking a peek at this <@UEC65BQV8> and mentioned they'd follow up with you.
In the meantime, check this out and see if it helps: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/how-to-make-custom-code-work-with-cms>
Yeah, I checked it out. I mean, it makes sense why its happening, I think its just a question of should it. I have no dog in the fight :dog:
thanks for following up <@U22PKFRU5>
This got handled in a direct message actually.  Looks like the form was attempting to submit to a script that didn’t exist

Hi thanks.
I think I might have expressed myself wrong. What I meant was that we are currently running on HubSpot, and everything is great. Now we are doing a re-launch, and the website that is in the staging environment, is sometimes pretty slow.

We were wondering if this is a staging issue… or if it will also be slow once set live

Hummmm, that's hard for me to tell without looking at it. I haven't heard of any sites being slower in content staging vs live. I have heard of chat/video/js related stuff lagging speeds down.

I would suggest giving the support team a call and having them review what the site looks like - they may be able to give you some suggestions and ideas.
If there is a content staging bug/slowdown, they can log an issue ticket for us to dig deeper on the product side.
Do you have lots of external JS loading (chat, video, popups, etc)?
with the two-factor authentication enabled is there a way to get access to the FTP working again or we sh*t out of luck?
Heya <@U7BQUDTEJ>, is that 2FA enabled portal-wide for you?
i don’t believe so. is there a way to figure out?
i’ll private DM you

<@UBAN5HW3A> there usually isn't a noticeable performance difference between staging and production. I would assume if it's slow in staging, it's going to be slow when you go live as well. I'd suggest using some of the speed testing tools <@U7SL518D6> and <@U22PKFRU5> suggested on the staged site.
curious why the default for the forms embed code is dropping in iframes even for paid accounts. I feel like we went back in time
Hello all! Checking to see if anyone familiar with HS embedded forms can help me out w/ a bug that a client of ours is having w/ their forms
(If this isn't the right place, please point me in the right direction :pray: )
Here's a sample page w/ a form: <https://sw.aveva.com/blog/how-new-digital-capabilities-can-transform-legacy-operational-technology>

As you can see, checkboxes aren't visually responding to clicks. If I dig into the React dev tools, I can see that the values are changing from `checked: false` to `checked: true`, but the inputs don't change visually

Hi <@UDJATA926> - cool to post here and see what happens :slightly_smiling_face: I would suggest cross-posting in the official dev support forums: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Developers/ct-p/developers>

And for this specific issue, it might be worth a quick call into Support. They may be able to trouble shoot it ... and if it is a bug... log a ticket with our product team to dig deeper. :slightly_smiling_face:
but we can also see what comes up in slack :slightly_smiling_face:
Thanks for your input
